body_html: I could do that - however, the function evaluate_once() is not equivalent to the one in the documentation, which would have been useful for cases like evaluating the current model (not checkpointed) while in the training loop. Is there a reason why that functionality has been removed? Or has it been replaced by something else?

body: I could do that - however, the function evaluate_once() is not equivalent to the one in the documentation, which would have been useful for cases like evaluating the current model (not checkpointed) while in the training loop. Is there a reason why that functionality has been removed? Or has it been replaced by something else?
